website_summaries.verdict: Provides impressive speed and range for several devices at a relatively good price.
pros: Handles several WiFi devices, has a USB port for a networked hard drive and is fast enough for gaming and streaming video
cons: Starts to bog down when more than 10 devices are in use
Some models seem to need a lot of rebooting

customer_reviews.title: Poor Warranty support
customer_reviews.text: Product died 7 weeks after purchase and only a couple days of use. Amazon put me in touch with Netgear support representative who told me (1) it was defective hardware (2) it was covered under warranty (3) took my information name/address/etc (4) then told me I had to speak to another department to get a replacement (5) Transferred me to a number with 23 people in front of me (6) after about 15 minute and being the 20th caller in line, I gave up figuring it would take at least 2 hours before a human being got on with me.
customer_reviews.author: JWS

customer_reviews.title: it works ok
customer_reviews.text: not sure if it is because I got a second hand unit or just the router itself but it works ok. seems to drop my connections often never as fast as it is started to be. i have already replaced it to be honest. though the netgear user app is very easy to use and works great. this was my second netgear router and i wish it worked as well as my old one. but instead it didn't so i went and got a new tp-link one instead and i love it
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bentine

customer_reviews.title: I am getting close to update this poor little router or install a secondary access point
customer_reviews.text: 42 months and still running strong. I only reboot after installing updates. Last time I investigated a potential, I found a corroded cable connector between cable modem and the world to be the culprit. I am getting close to update this poor little router or install a secondary access point. 10 heavy use devices seems to be the max that it handles well. You would be surprised how many devices are actually connected to your router.
customer_reviews.author: Bama Boy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, blazing fast speeds.
customer_reviews.text: This router along with a Arris Surfboard 6141 replaced the gateway that was supplied by comcast. The difference is night and day. It was extremely easy to set up and the dual band is great for devices that are 5G compatible. Blazing fast speeds. The Netgear Genie app is also very convenient. Due to where we have to keep our router in our house we paired this with Netgear AC1200 range extender for additional coverage upstairs. If this router was centrally located it would have provided more than enough coverage.
customer_reviews.author: LinwoodMommy

customer_reviews.title: Connection dies many times per day
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of the refurbished router I bought. I've noticed I lose internet from the router fairly often, something on the order of once every hour. This lasts about 30 seconds before it starts working again. Its not clear to me whether my computer is actually disconnecting from the wifi, or if something else is going on. Sometimes my wifi icon doesn't change, and sometimes it shows it disconnected. I'm on the 2.4Ghz (because my wifi card doesn't support 5Ghz). I've never had a router that effs the connection like this. I may have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Tetrud

customer_reviews.title: Tomato users beware
customer_reviews.text: this router supposedly performs great on Netgear's firmware - but if you are planning to put Tomato firmware on it, be advised there is apparently a known bug where the 2.4ghz radio does not work properly. I can confirm after installing many builds and flavors of Tomato that, although everything else including 5ghz seemed to work fine, 2.4ghz was basically non-functional.......and this is an officially supported Tomato model
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: and I can stream with chromecast from my computer to tv at full HD with little to pretty much no lag or buffering times
customer_reviews.text: My WIFI now stretches across my whole house, and I can stream with chromecast from my computer to tv at full HD with little to pretty much no lag or buffering times, def worth the price tag! My previous Router, I had to move much closer to the tv to keep streaming speeds up. This is a long term purchase, why cheap out on something that will restrict your internet speeds, especially with the premiums you pay for high speed data anymore, dont let your devices be the bottleneck, let it be the ISP so we can hopefully get rid of this monopoly they have.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: The best router I have ever had. It was very easy to set up and works very well with my wireless connections. I was constantly getting dropped from overwhelming my old router. But Netgear handles it like a champ. It was the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Will Petrey

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. Solid, fast Internet
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It seemed to take a few days to figure itself out but now I get solid 60mb/s on all floors of my house. I keep this in my basement office so it stays cool and I still get solid internet in my bedroom on the 2nd floor. That is 2 floors up from the router. I can watch Youtube on my phone at 1080P with no lag. I also love the phone app for configuration.
customer_reviews.author: hopalicious

customer_reviews.title: Limited range for w-fi
customer_reviews.text: The wireless range on this router is limited and it seems to "go to sleep" when it's not in use. I purchased it with the NETGEAR WiFi USB 2.0 Adapter - AC Dual Band (A6200) to use in my home office. I am less than 100 feet away and the connection is spotty, at best :0( The wi-fi signal in my bedroom (about the same distance in the opposite direction, with my iphone, is also lousy. Our house is a 1500 sq ft ranch, very compact, and the living room/kitchen are the only places with good signal.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this router
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. Easy app to maintain it. Easy installation steps. Coverage is good. Occasionally i had to restart but nothing like big this to complain.
customer_reviews.author: viper

customer_reviews.title: The router works great, however, Netgear support overall sucks
customer_reviews.text: I had to make 3 calls before I got a supervisor who finally understood how this thing works, but it is a total waste of your time and breath to think you will get help from the 1st tier personnel. If it weren't for the technology being so superior to everything else out there, I would have thrown up my hands and quit, it literally took me 5 hours on the phone, with numerous persons before I was able to get a competent person on the phone. However, My windows 7 Ultimate based computer somehow keeps losing the settings, and I have to practically go through the entire setup process constantly.
customer_reviews.author: MikeSkysoldier

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest router I've ever set up, and I have done many. I wasn't crazy about the way it sticks up in the air, sitting on just one small edge, but it is more stable than I thought it would be. The interface is good and the setup was so easy I couldn't believe I was finished already. I have always bought Linksys routers prior to this one. I'm glad I decided to try something new. I haven't tested coverage around the house but I also haven't noticed any bad spots so it appears to be working well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Corson

customer_reviews.title: The best modem I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: With my last router, I was constantly having to reset the thing, since buying this maybe a year ago, I have not touched it once, nor had any problems. Setup was brainless and instant, no tweaks or troubleshooting, great range all over my two story townhouse and my internet speeds improved. Great modem. Thank you wire cutter for the recommendation and thank you Netgear for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Pfister

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, solid performance and looks nice...possibly used.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was straight forward, iOS app for router is serviceable and better than expected from reviews in App Store. Router is replacing an 8+yr old Netgear, so comparing performance is silly. Only bummer was that it was obvious that the box I received had been opened and a return at the very least, as the protective film was heavily marked and the default setting for wifi were not the Netgear standard, but 'FBI' and 'FBI-5G'. I factory restored and updated the firmware and everything was as it was new, just unfortunate when you are sold 'new'.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy. Takes up very little space on the table
customer_reviews.text: Fast service, but got lost at the Post Office so delivery was delayed. Setup was easy. Takes up very little space on the table. Good lighting display at the base and center of the screen confirms it's working. This replaced my old Netgear but has a better connection and doesn't drop the signal as often, even though I'm off the grid and connect through the phone system on a cable but not fiberoptic. Reasonably priced. Personal use only--not business or multi-layered.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Love & Hate
customer_reviews.text: This router has most all the features I need. I mean it has EVERYTHING that the Best routers have EXCEPT it's Not Compatible with CHROMECAST!!!!! WTH!?!!?!! After trying to get Chromecast to work through it for almost 6hrs, researching all of the Internet, trying over & over only to Finally find out its not Compatible with Chromecast! WTH
customer_reviews.author: Jasonsc1

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy set up! straight forward, easy to understand & implement instructions. Could not be more pleased. No problems with connectivity etc. Would definitely recommend this router. I actually was renting this same model from my carrier & was tired of paying a monthly rental fee when I could own outright. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie B

customer_reviews.title: Love the WPS button to connect units like security cameras ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old Netgear router with this one about 2 weeks ago. Love the WPS button to connect units like security cameras instantly. Took almost 15 minutes for this IT novice, largely because I had to read the directions! No problem so far with 13-15 devices being managed by the system. I also like the network map showing what units are attached; by IP address, sometimes by proper name. With the unit in the basement, I think I have to research an issue reaching a device in the ground-level garage about 80-90' away.
customer_reviews.author: Jagster

customer_reviews.title: Defective, and the seller knows it.
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective. One of THE CPU cores is disabled and only half the RAM is being utilized. Furthermore, my 5 year old actiontec has a better WiFi antenna than this junk. Tried everything from dd-wrt to tomato but no luck. I tried to have it replaced but the serial number was blacked out the seller when I got it. they must have known. Beware of the seller EMBIZ.
customer_reviews.author: Nouman Arif

customer_reviews.title: Worst $100 I have ever spent
customer_reviews.text: I have used NETGEAR products before and had no problems; the last was a 650 router running multiple devices at a time for three years, no problems until it died. This will not run one computer for 45 minutes with out dropping the signal: in all fairness you can have five devices running until it drops the signal. One of the tvs is hard wired for internet and no problem with droping its signal, so I am sure its the WIFI. Worst $100 I have ever spent. I would give a ZERO if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished. Works without any issues. Solid Performer.
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished. Works without any issues. I consistently get 29Mbps Internet Speeds on Wireless or Wired with the 20Mbps Comcast PowerBoost connection. File transfer between computer on the internal network over WIFI AC is blazing fast. Using the USB port for Printer Sharing. Very easy setup. Solid Performer.
customer_reviews.author: BKP

customer_reviews.title: The genie app is great (laptop, still haven't tried the mobile)
customer_reviews.text: This router can be used with Centurylink VDSL2 unlike the ac1200, THIS IS A ROUTER ONLY!! you need a modem and i didnt read carefully... i had a c1000a modem & router in 1, but i used it as a modem for this ac1600 i just used the ethernet cable. I also had to go turn off the wifi for my c1000a that way i didn't have 3 networks but just two, the 2.4 and the 5.0. The genie app is great (laptop, still haven't tried the mobile). I still have yet to see it in the long run, but my first impressions are that it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Netgear AC1600 Dual Band Wi-Fi Gigabit Router, was very easy to set up, have had it going for a couple months now, everything seems fine, computer speeds have improved, but this one was too be a lot faster than our many year old one. the Netgear does seem to connect better and faster, and doesn't drop connections. So we are happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gross

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: My first impression of this router was good. It was a lot faster than the previous unit we had. After approximately a year of use the speed has dropped off on both channels making them virtually unusable. When first installed we were achieving about 18mbps on the 5g connection. Now we are lucky to break 2mbps. I have reset and changed settings to no avail. I am currently getting @ 17mbps at the modem, so I know the connection is good. I'm not sure what happened to this unit, but if it only lasts a year I would look elsewhere if you're in the market for a good, reliable router.
customer_reviews.author: L-Con

customer_reviews.title: After about six months, our internet connection slowed to ...
customer_reviews.text: After about six months, our internet connection slowed to nearly non-existent. I thought it was the cable company throttling us, but after plugging my computer directly into the back of the cable modem, the speeds were normal. We finally isolated it to the router. This is the second Netgear router/modem I've bought that failed to work (the other never worked from the start) and I would NEVER buy Netgear again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steckbeck

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre router
customer_reviews.text: Better router from other companies: the older router it replaced (Netgear WNR834B) actually had better range, though it was terribly difficult to install (no WPS) without tech support. The repeater, also Netgear did have WPS button, but when iPad had to be relocated, the WPS button actually fell away, and when pushed again, it fell into the black casing! Customer care had no intention of helping replace this defective repeater. This router has been replaced with the Securifi Almond Router.
customer_reviews.author: keokebe1

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for over a year, absolutely no issues with NetGear product. This is one of three.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective WiFi
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a failing Modem / WiFi with this WiFI. Worth the money, now that we have more gadgets scattered through the house. Since the old unit still had a working DSL modem, we simply used that to connect the AC1600 to the Internet. Several new techniques are used to maximize throughput over WiFi and prevent drops. This WiFi device works very well.
customer_reviews.author: RetroReader

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, using as a second AP on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, using as a second AP on my network to expand range and AC capabilities. Haven't noticed any real problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Nice router.
customer_reviews.text: Been using for about a year and this router has performed well. It gives me great coverage and connectivity is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived early, which was helpful, carefully packed, simple instructions, easy to set up, and working within minutes. Unit works as advertised and functions perfectly. I researched routers on line and would buy again if necessary. I found through research of online reviews as well that spending a bit more money on the unit added value for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Gumo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Really great router for the money! Pretty powerful and allowed me to get the full 175Mbps we are paying for via the cable company.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dank

customer_reviews.title: ... this router about 10 days ago and I’m VERY pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought and installed this router about 10 days ago and I’m VERY pleased with my purchase. I had been having trouble with my old router and had to reset it a couple of times a day. Since installing the NETGEAR AC1600 I haven’t had to reset once. The speed of my downloads are great at about 19mbs wireless. I also have an external hard drive that I had been using as a backup. I just plugged it into the USB port and it became a shared drive with all the computers on my home network. No muss or fuss about it. I would recommend this router to anyone that asked me.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great router with great signaling
customer_reviews.text: Great router with great signaling. I was surprised how strong the signal was even though there were no external antenna's. I may upgrade to external antennas in the future, but I am satisfied with the device for now. What's better is that the OS already has advanced features once only available through aftermarket router firmware such as guest WiFI and VPN clients.
customer_reviews.author: Gamefanatic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up and works fine. Broadcasts (and receives) both 2.4 and 5 GHz bands. Has a USB connector for an external hard drive, which can be used for network backup from any computer logged in to the wifi. Very convenient for automatically synchronizing files across multiple computers.
customer_reviews.author: Jhs

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand. Netgear not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Loses internet and Netgear only supports it for 2-3 months. You have to pay them to get support after the initial period. Product is very faulty and Netgear does not stand behind the product. I recommend another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Coleman

customer_reviews.title: There is lots of interference but it still works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: The unit is a bit ostentatious, but it works well. Unit is in upstairs office and works well throughout entire home in townhouse complex. There is lots of interference but it still works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: T Jared Slaydon

customer_reviews.title: working good. i do switch off/on every 15 to 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: working good. i do switch off/on every 15 to 20 days just so that there is no hanging data.
customer_reviews.author: Hari Vunnava

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Second time I've had this modem. Works great!!! I live in a household of 9 and this modem handles all the devices excellent! I really love the Parental Control feature. I can rest easy at night knowing that every browser is safe!
customer_reviews.author: Bub

customer_reviews.title: Better than most for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Can be slow at times, or looses connection with WIFI all together. It is advertised for large homes, so I assumed that it would provide me with the signal strength I need. Beats the Comcast router I was using! Overall, it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: HappierThanMost

customer_reviews.title: This was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up, and it has been working well ever since without any problems. The only negative comment I have is that the coverage throughout my house isn't as strong as I would like. I had a wireless "G" standard router previously, and that provided coverage as good or even better than this one. This is the only "AC" router I have used in my home, so I can't say how it would compare to another model.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: Best Router for Home With Many Devices
customer_reviews.text: A roomer (renting a room in our home) had purchased this router about a year ago and it worked just fine for our house full of cell phones, laptops, tablets, and gaming systems, plus guests. After the roomer moved, we needed to buy another router. We purchased the Netgear 6200thinking that we could save a buck. WRONG. We took that one back and ordered what we already knew worked! the Netgear 6250. If you have 8 or more devices in your home this router is the way to go! strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kofyshop

customer_reviews.title: It's a solid choice if you're looking to upgrade an older router.
customer_reviews.text: It's and nice piece of hardware. The instructions were easy and made setup a breeze. It has two bands and an optional guest option if you want to go that route. So far I am enjoying it. Configuration took a little time but that was me tweaking the settings but other than that it's awesome. I use it for streaming and playing killing floor and both work wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Lorne J.

customer_reviews.title: bought the google wifi system and everything is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It works but my house needed a bigger reach, bought the google wifi system and everything is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tere Melgarejo

customer_reviews.title: Needed Good range: Got Great range!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up, and haven't had any issues whatsoever. We have a 3 story home built in 1918 and still get decent reception on the 3rd floor with the router set-up in a cabinet on our 1st floor. I haven't used any of the parental controls or data transfer plug in ports. My rating is based on the reception and speed only which is as good as advertised. One thing that is not mentioned in the specs but is nice is that there are 4 ethernet ports on the back, so you are able to connect a number of wired devices as well if necessary (such as a tv, gaming console, etc) I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James Damon II

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This router works great for me. I have several wireless devices throughout my home and I get good reception everywhere. No lagging downloads or buffering movies. It is a good fit for my home.
customer_reviews.author: Kodiak Girl

customer_reviews.title: Previously owned a Netgear router but connections throughout the house ...
customer_reviews.text: Previously owned a Netgear router but connections throughout the house were weak. Had to reboot it frequently. Read a lot of reviews, BEFORE we purchased the AC1600. Many stated that they had large homes and many devices and ran them all without issues. We've been using ours for about a month and it drops the signal, BUT we can turn wi fi off/on at each device and get the signal WITHOUT reboot. Still isn't what we had hoped for, but will do for now.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra DiLallo

customer_reviews.title: Return modem
customer_reviews.text: the modem is not working, I want to return it and I want my money back .I went to UPS to return the product and they charged me $ 25 to ship, I don't want to pay anything to return, I already paid for a bad product
customer_reviews.author: Lara Martins

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to manage and also supports
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd year of using it. Really easy to manage and also supports VPN
customer_reviews.author: Yanhao Lin

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Really great router. It has convenient buttons for discovery on the side and it looks sleek. Of course, the stats are where it's at. I get 90+ Mbs on my wifi through this router. That is near 100% of the speed I receive wired in. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Malaria

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router for the price, but I bought it primarily for the range - which is not great. I have a 3-bedroom house (not a McMansion). The router is in the den. As long as you are in the 3 rooms surrounding the den, you're good. Otherwise it's slow, or non-existent. You will likely need an extender if you have a house.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Works well and looks sharp. Con to this was it would not run the signal through our house although I had believed that it might. Finally had to invest in a NETGEAR extender and no all seems well. Could have stayed with the Belkin I had and just bought the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: I like it but it would not work with my VPN ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but it would not work with my VPN - even though it should have and does work for a friend but not with my network.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been "another brand" wireless routers and I am dissapointed, after 11 months of use, the devices just start dropping devices... even the wired ones.... then I decided to change and bought Netgear.... 3 years and still working..........needed a second one... of course my choice..........Netgear....
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: stepup
customer_reviews.text: excellent step up from my basic starter router. Combined wth Extender also by Nertgear 6100 I have virtually covered the entire house and outdoor deck areas. Minimal tech knowledge required and Netgear will walk you through any roughspots if you manage to find any
customer_reviews.author: joe natale

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to install after downloading some needed programs
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install after downloading some needed programs. Easy to see and setup the network. On this first day of use I feel the router was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: A no-brainer if you can pick one up refurbished (and appropriately discounted)
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased it refurbished, I don't have to justify full retail price to be happy. Setup was easy enough for the most part and I haven't had to reset anything since setting it up (nearly a daily occurrence when depending on the wireless router functionality built into my cable modem)
customer_reviews.author: A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Linksys that was conking out. Works really well and the set up was easy. I do not find the range to be all that great but it does work in my 2 story house every where. The link just isn't real strong the farther away you get. All in all, pretty pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashfault

customer_reviews.title: The setup was very easy on the Netgear R6250 device
customer_reviews.text: The setup was very easy on the Netgear R6250 device, but the documentation could be better. I know how to change the SSID name, but others may not and it was not clear if you don't know how to. Other that than, the product works great with the 9 devices that I have (3 iPhones, 2 iPads, 1 iPad mini, 1 apple TV, 1 Roku, 1 apple iMac). The genie app is easy and can see the traffic (average download speed). Right now averaging over 1000mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Constantly lost signal and slow downloads at times. Switched back to my Apple time capsule and did not experience this issue. Still use it with a wired connection to one computer but regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Dead in just under 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. Good for just a couple years, then nothing
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Good router, but didn't work with my Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: It's a good router, very easy setup, very stable, the range is pretty good. Unfortunately, it doesn't work with my Apple TV(A1469). it drops out every 5 minutes if I steam vides from my MacBook Pro, iPad and iPhone is okay. after I asked help from their tech support team, they gave me a new firmware, it fixed the issue when I steaming local vides, but for online videos like Youtube, it still didn't work. By the way, their support team is pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: Jingxue Wang

customer_reviews.title: Best router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best router for the price! FAST, BEAMFORMING, easy to setup. Nice features...GREAT COVERAGE with wireless! Reaches 3 stories! Handles VOIP, TORRENTS, WOW, NETFLIX and GUILD WARS 2 with out a sweat!
customer_reviews.author: Computer Sage

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: its alright. my last router was broken and would drop signal all the time so i cant really compare it to anything but i still had to buy a range extender.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: This router has been very good. I only live in a 2 bedroom condo but there is not a single spot in my condo that doesn't get great wireless signal from this router. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Gensicke

customer_reviews.title: for us it was a much better alternative than a Wi-Fi "extender"
customer_reviews.text: We had a Centurylink modem for the church and it was upstairs. So, it had to penetrate the upper floor, wiring, etc. to get to the front of the stage down stairs where the pastor speaks. He uses his cellphone to advance the slides for his presentation. It would work on and off depending on conditions, so I decided to get this after reading other reviews about Wi-Fi extenders vs this router and we have had no problems with connections. So, for us it was a much better alternative than a Wi-Fi "extender". The range is about 430 feet!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: expected better performance seems need an signal extender and the reason ...
customer_reviews.text: expected better performance seems need an signal extender and the reason I bought was to take care of longer range is not better than any regular router
customer_reviews.author: jack serrano

customer_reviews.title: and the Duel Band takes the heavy downloading much better than a single band router
customer_reviews.text: Gives me the fastest connection My Internet Provider offers, and the Duel Band takes the heavy downloading much better than a single band router, I can choose which band I want to operate various wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: B. T.

customer_reviews.title: Poor signal strength, drops connections
customer_reviews.text: Terrible range for an expensive router, and dropped connections regularly even when I was within signal range. Heck, even the Comc*** router/modem had better coverage than this - same wires, same position, double the signal strength. I may have gotten a dud unit, but it went back either way.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this router
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this router. Even after updating and resetting it would drop connections multiple times a day. Replaced with a different model
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Ready in minutes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace asus router that had connection issues with family members' iOS devices. This router was probably the easiest to setup. And the app for it on the phone makes it easy to maintain
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great router for medium to large homes
customer_reviews.text: My access point is in the basement and I have a three-story home. I had a hard time finding a router that would get a decent signal to the second level, let alone the third one. This router not only gets great signal to the third level, but I have 10-14 devices active throughout the house and I have no problems as far as network access.
customer_reviews.author: Mohan Singh

customer_reviews.title: It handles multiple streaming devices well and was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my apartment for a year and had no issues. It handles multiple streaming devices well and was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: Astoundingly bad! Arrived with a blinking green power indicator. Could not login to router URL nor access the Internet, let alone wirelessly. Looking at various support pages, it appears the router arrived bricked with corrupted firmware. It is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Squoosh

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best router so far. It has been almost 20-30 days and Range and speed of the router is really good. USB 3 is fast for data transfer and Netgear gennie is awsome. So far I liked it. Best for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Milan Patel

customer_reviews.title: but it seems only slightly better than the Linksys it replaced
customer_reviews.text: This router got high ratings, but it seems only slightly better than the Linksys it replaced. To get full coverage, I'm using it with a Netgear extender. The combination works well enough, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy!
customer_reviews.text: The range of this router is terrible. Our previous router the WNDR3800 had awesome range, all through the house plus quite far outside. This router will not reach the second floor or even a few steps past the back door. Looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Southeast of Disorder

customer_reviews.title: Good UI. Perhaps lacks a whole lots of manual ...
customer_reviews.text: My experience with an ac router, also my first experience with a high quality router. Very fast with a strong signal. Good UI. Perhaps lacks a whole lots of manual control, but you can just install dd-wrt if that's what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Phil G

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy set up. Love it. It seems much stronger than what we had before. The genie is great too.
customer_reviews.author: TiMonte

customer_reviews.title: Great performance/dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and amazing range. Is able to broadcast on both the 5GHz and 2.4GHz bands through multiple thick walls - very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Y.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Receved when expected, item was as advertised, all as usual
customer_reviews.author: L. Howard Ewing III

customer_reviews.title: Funny shape but works well
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup. Works seamlessly with wifi devices. Shape is strange but takes up little desk space.
customer_reviews.author: tractorm6

customer_reviews.title: It's so nice to have a router that can handle the download ...
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to have a router that can handle the download and upload speed that I have now. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: southarin

customer_reviews.title: It works very well and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I do not have aby complains about this product. It works very well and easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: nsscm

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from Netgear
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, but from a Netgear router I expected much better. I frequently had issues with dropped or very weak signals and slow internet speeds. I was only looking to cover about 1,200 sq ft, single story condo but with no luck. Maybe I got a defective product, but I opted to go with another brand/router instead and haven't had issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Eitel

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.  Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Performs as listed. No glitches in startup. It works fine and would highly recommend it for price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: gary orehovec

customer_reviews.title: ... TRAILER AND THE OTHER ONE WORKS AT HOME WITH GREAT RECEPTION EVEN OUT IN THE GARAGE
customer_reviews.text: WORKS VERY WELL IN MY TRAVEL TRAILER AND THE OTHER ONE WORKS AT HOME WITH GREAT RECEPTION EVEN OUT IN THE GARAGE ..
customer_reviews.author: Cougar

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but I was expected better coverage throughout our ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but I was expected better coverage throughout our home. Coverage is no better than our old CenturyLink/Actiontec. Somewhat difficult to set up since I had to use the CenturyLink/Actiontec as a modem and reconfigure it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Had this item for almost 2 months now and have not encountered any problems yet. I've purchased other routers in the past, but this router is by far the easiest to install.
customer_reviews.author: alybear808

customer_reviews.title: wasted many hours
customer_reviews.text: wouldn't install on my win 7 system utilizing Comcast modem....wasted many hours....including an attempt at professional installation...installed cheaper Netgear 900 series with no problems
customer_reviews.author: P. DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: I got this router in an effort to fix my VOIP phone. Turned out the phone had a bad power supply but the router did increase my download speed and there are less drops of coverage. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: Router replaced D-Link router that served me well for several years. This router was a breeze to setup and use. I have had some trouble with sharing my HP printer via the USB port, but I have not had any other issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Great price. Great experience with shipper. I would recommend this shipper for products.
customer_reviews.author: A.Kirbstreet

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speed
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Dual band really lets your partition what devices go on each network. For me all mobile devices got placed on the 2.4ghz side and my others 5ghz. Speeds are amazing. If you want more wifi speed to your than your regular router this is a very good option.
customer_reviews.author: Zechariah McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Worked great right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right out of the box. Super fast and paired with my wifi extender seamlessly with WPS. Took about 10 minutes from start to finish. It's smaller than the dimensions listed in the details (which is good) about an 8X8 square.
customer_reviews.author: JEREMY H.

customer_reviews.title: The first one I got stopped working bout 25 days ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got stopped working bout 25 days in but so far second one is doing OK. Doesn't have as far of range as I thought it would but it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Beish

customer_reviews.title: DHCP stopped working
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for about 3 weeks, then dhcp suddenly stopped working. now it only works with static ips set for every device.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Kevlin

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Dual band works as it should. Have not had any problems and I do not expect any. Got it on sale - was $20.00 less than other sites. Live in a 2200 sq foot house. Modem is on the first floor. I get coverage throughout the house. Have not checked outside yet - nor do I plan to. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: WI-FI
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to upgrade my home wi-FI system and this was the perfect component. Easy to set up and easy to put into operation. I am going from a smaller slow Netgear router to this one and it has handled all of our devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Love

product_meta.title: NETGEAR AC1600 Dual Band Wi-Fi Gigabit Router (R6250)
product_meta.description: The NETGEAR R6250 Smart Wi-Fi Router with AC dual band Gigabit delivers AC1600 Wi-Fi speeds. It offers the best wireless coverage for large homes and is ideal for homes with 8 or more wireless devices. It also provides the best connectivity for dual band wireless devices like iPad and iPhone5.
feature_bullets: Provides an extensible design that enables service prioritization for data
Design that delivers high availability, scalability, and for maximum flexibility and price/performance
The country of origin is China
Compatible with next generation Wi-Fi devices and backward compatible with 802.11 a/b/g/n devices, it enables HD streaming throughout your home.
With up to 300 + 1300Mbps speed and simultaneous dual band Wi-Fi technology, the R6250 avoids wireless interference, ensuring top Wi-Fi Speeds and reliable connections.
The dual-core 800Mhz processor delivers high-performance connectivity, while the USB 3.0 port provides up to 10x faster USB hard drive access.

specifications.Operating System: Windows 7, 8, Vista, XP, 2000; Mac OS, UNIX, or Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars729 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
